title: How to earn money online without investment - Quora

response.answer_text: I once made $2,600 within a few minutes. No, it was not a drug deal and yes, it was perfectly legal. But first, let’s talk about 4 major mistakes that most people make when they ask a question like this one: They only think of “investment” in terms of “money.” EVERYBODY has assets that could be used and leveraged as investments. For example, before they became Uber drivers, their cars were not business assets. But once they join Uber, they can make money from that asset. Same with Airbnb. So get creative. Look at the assets you do have, and use/leverage them to make $$$.They only think of “investment” as “their money” (you can always get others to invest, but of course, you gotta be persuasive)They never consider past investments they made, and thus never leverage such investments (including the trust they built in their social/professional network)They try to be creative from a place of scarcity, of fear, of stress and of negativity. Nothing comes out of nothing. Something comes out of something. So a better question is, “How can I make x dollars by using my y education, my z experience, and my w skills?” Abundance can only come from abundance.How many ways to make money? Infinite ways. The number is limited only by your imagination (or, more precisely, your willingness to let your imagination run WILD and give you tons and tons of ideas, which you implement, and you then keep the good ideas). I’ve got hundreds of ideas, and will update this answer with them over time. But here’s one: contact the prolific Quora writers, and pitch to them the idea of compiling their best answers into an ebook that you can sell on Gumroad, and you split the profits with the authors (there can be MANY authors in this ebook). Note: The $2600 was a finder’s fee for connecting a buyer and seller.

To make online there is no mandatory rule to invest. In fact who can make money online without investment , they reach to long term and established online marketer. Like I have never spent any dime to drive traffic. So, the question is if you can earn money online without investment ? Right ? Yes, You can obviously !!!  Here are some ways with which you can make money without any investments :  1. BLOGGINGBlogging is one of the most popular and best ways to earn money online. Most importantly, you are getting paid by writing while sitting at home. For free blogs, you just need to sign up and start writing blogs. BlogSpot(Bloggers) is the most popular platform for writing free blogs. Below I will mention all the popular platforms (both free and paid) for blogging. 2. As a Freelancer : Freelancer users typically pocket around anywhere $4 to $100 per hour depending upon their niche, level of expertise and difficulty of the project. Which freelancing sites are best for beginners? Upwork Freelancer Fiverr PeoplePerHour How can you get a freelance job with no experience? Focus on getting certifications as well working on resume plus on how do you bid on different projects. The more personalized responses with better answer to customer issues can make you win a job quickly. 3. YOUTUBEYes, you heard right you can make money by uploading videos to YouTube. Nowadays most of the people prefer YouTube than google search. And it takes only a few minutes to create your channel and upload videos. But I suggest uploading videos according to your interest so that you didn’t get bored and enjoy creating videos. You know most of the YouTubers start the channel, upload some videos and then quit. Why? Because they don’t know what to upload next. That’s why I recommend to everyone that before starting the youtube channel first decide your niche. TIP – Keep uploading videos, grow audience and have patience. Once youtube start recommending your channel then you will know how much you earn. Patience is the only key to success in this field. 4. Selling Courses Online : You can make money selling service online If you are good at a particular field of knowledge, or if you have a particular skill in which you specialize in, then I have a good news for you and that is, You can earn money online fast by selling your knowledge in terms of courses online. There are many sites where you can upload and sell your course. One such example is, Udemy. 5. MAKE MONEY AS A VIRTUAL ASSISTANT :Get clear on your WHY – Staying connected to your Why will keep you focused, centered, and help you move your business forward. Especially on those days when you lack motivation (it happens to all of us!). Read my Why here. Create your service offerings – Take a look at your existing skills and talents to create services that you enjoy doing. Get clear on what you want to offer. Figure out your ideal client -Who do you want to work with? Learn how to determine who your ideal client is and why it’s so important. Identify your niche – Now that you know the services you want to offer and the type of client you want to work with, you might see a niche or a theme. Your niche is basically what you specialize in. What type of VA do you want to be? Is there a specific industry you want to work in? Don’t worry if you don’t quite have a niche yet! You’ll figure it out eventually!  6. As an Affiliate Marketer :Are you interested in affiliate marketing but worried that you need loads of money to get into the business? Well, we have good news for you. You can definitely get started in affiliate marketing, even if you’re short on cash. There are just a few things you need to understand first. What is Affiliate Marketing All About? With affiliate marketing, you make money by promoting products and services to your audience members and referring them to the websites of retailers selling those products and services. When someone you refer purchases something or completes an action, such as signing up for a service or an email list, you earn a commission. This marketing technique benefits both the advertiser and affiliate. The affiliate gets paid while the seller makes a sale. Bloggers Use Affiliate Marketing These days many bloggers use affiliate marketing to earn money. You may have heard that some of the best bloggers out there are making as much as $40 thousand each month on affiliate sales alone. Of course, to make this kind of money, you have to have a huge, loyal audience. But what if you don’t have that kind of following? Let alone a blog at all? Can you still become an affiliate? Fortunately, the answer is yes. No Money, No Worries! We want to start by saying that having a blog and website should be your ultimate goal as an affiliate marketer. It is, hands down, the best way to run a successful affiliate marketing business. However, when you’re new to the business and you’re on a shoestring budget (or have no budget at all) there are a few things you can do to start generating the income you’ll need to eventually start your website and blog. Create a Social Media Presence Being an affiliate doesn’t mean you have to become a blogger right away. Instead, you can begin monetizing your online presence through social media. You can do this by placing affiliate links within your posts, updates, and profiles. Social media platforms like Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest and so on are packed with millions of users. You can easily integrate links into your posts and see results. Just make sure to follow the rules and restrictions of these sites, as you technically don’t own your accounts. Be on Facebook A lot of people, in fact, billions of people, are in Facebook these days, which makes it the largest social media platform. If you have an account, you can promote affiliate products on your page. The important thing is to focus your page on a subject of interest to your audience. It could be health, money, fitness, relationships, or pretty much anything else folks are interested in learning about. Be a YouTube Star Have you ever considered starting a YouTube channel? If not, then this is the best time to do so! YouTube is an incredibly effective platform for affiliate marketing and has millions of users. The most successful YouTubers are earning millions each year just by making videos promoting products they enjoy. This is perhaps one of the best ways to become an affiliate without investing in a blog and website. Just know that you won’t likely have very many subscribers in your first few months, but if you keep posting interesting and useful videos, you’ll eventually build the audience you need to succeed. Join an Affiliate Program Once you’ve established your following on social media or YouTube, you can begin to apply for affiliate network programs like ShareASale and Rakuten. These programs are constantly seeking publishers who can promote well. However, to join these programs, you’ll need to qualify, and that usually means having a solid online presence and following. So it’s important that you have quality content to be considered a good source. What Should You Do Then?  If you’ve set your mind on becoming an affiliate, there’s no way to go but up. And if you’re truly determined, you should always approach your work with the best practices and strategies in mind. Building an audience is critical, as well, so follow the rules of the trade. And when you do become a good source of information, expect people to recommend the products you write about. Your opinion will become gold in the end. So to answer the question, can you do affiliate marketing without money? The answer is a resounding yes! It just takes time, patience, opportunity, and determination; the rest is history. It’s never too late to start!

Basically everyone one here will probably recommend stuff like surveys that'll make you a couple of dollars per hour. Realistically, you’ll need at least a little start up capital to earn real money. My favorite way to make money online with relatively low startup costs is re-skinning apps. You can get started with $50 - $150. Last year I was able to make over $15,000 working just 1 hour per week and this past January I was able to make $6,199 working just 2–3 hours per week. If you think $50 - $150 is a lot, just think about the profits you can make. The investment could make you over $2,000 in just a couple of weeks! Re-skinning apps is a pretty simple process. Basically, you purchase/create a template, change the graphics of the template, and then sell the app. The entire process will take between 1 and 3 hours depending on your experience. After having re-skinned apps for over a year now, I’ve found that the typical re-skinned app sells for between $100 and $300. However, I’ve had single re-skins that have sold for over $2,000! If re-skinning sounds like something you want to try, I would first recommend looking at Chupamobile. Chupamobile is a marketplace to buy app templates. They usually cost between $50 and $250. However, once you buy a template once, you can re-skin it an unlimited amount of times! After you decided on your first template, you’re going to need to re-skin the app. I’ve found that simplicity is the best when re-skinning apps. I typically just change the icon, colors, screenshots, text, and backgrounds of the app. I wouldn’t try to add features because this is time consuming and the return isn’t usually that great. After completing the re-skin, you’re almost finished with your first app! Now you just have to sell it on Flippa, a marketplace for buying and selling apps and websites. If this sounds like a good way to make money for you, you should definitely check out my YouTube Channel to see in-depth videos on how to re-skin apps efficiently. Also, join my Facebook Group so you can talk with other beginner re-skinners and learn from the experts too! I believe that somebody taking re-skinning apps seriously could make six figures in a year. I really recommend staying away from “free” online businesses because they won’t help you in the long run. I hope you can give re-skinning apps a try because I think its really a great way to start making money on a tight budget! Good luck!

Making Money Online Without Any Product Of Your Own 1. Make Money Online Blogging  Now here’s the thing, you’re NOT going to get PAID for simply blogging. You won’t get magical internet money for simply throwing up a blog post – BUT you can use your blog traffic to sell advertising, or even to drive sales to different products that pay you a commission for sending them the sale (this is what I do with my websites). Before you get too excited and throw up the first blog you can think of, you need to learn what to make your blog about, and what specific topics people are SEARCHING FOR that you should be blogging about. 2) Traffic: A successful Youtube affiliate marketer must attract the right kind of traffic and preferably, lots of it. You have to collaborate with other Youtubers with a lot of subscribers. Remember that people with a lot of subscribers are picky about whom they choose to associate with. So you need to offer a compelling proposition. For example: Say that you have a cooking channel and they have a fitness channel. You can create a series titled Easy 5-minute Recipes for Fitness Freaks. This way, you can get lots of subs within a matter of days. You get the idea. 3) Learn how to get the click: Your titles and thumbnails will decide whether or not people click on your videos. So optimize them and make them irresistible. (Bonus points, create a custom Youtube thumbnail using Amazingly Simple Graphic Design Software, or any of the other free graphics tools out there) 4) Post consistently: Some of the fastest growing channels post very often. You should seriously consider posting at least 3 videos a week during the initial phase. Sure, you may already have a job and other commitments. Just record a lot of material on weekends and spend some time each day editing and uploading content. Many new people make the mistake of uploading just one or two videos to test the waters. The problem is that if people like your content and want to watch more, you have none of it available. So upload at least 5 videos initially. If you fail to upload on a fairly consistent basis, your subs and views will drop and the competition will eat into your portion of the pie. Share your experiences with the product or service that you are promoting. Don’t forget to tell people about the links in the description.

One of the most frequently asked questions by my readers is “how can I make money online fast and easy without investment?” For this reason, I spend time every day looking for legitimate online jobs. Most of the jobs are in the following categories: reservations agent, writing, transcriptionist, teacher, proofreader, data entry, customer service, virtual assistant, captcha entry, and resume writer. Of course, no one wants to spend money or pay registration fees to find a legitimate online job, that’s why I use Pinterest. You will find boards that contain hundreds of ways to make money online and they are updated frequently! There are full and part-time jobs on these boards as well as jobs that offer benefits. Many jobs don’t require any previous experience to get started. Working For Yourself Some great options for people who prefer to work for themselves is affiliate marketing or selling products.  WHAT IS AFFILIATE MARKETING? It’s when you recommend a product or service that you believe in, to your readers or followers, and they make a purchase through your links or referral codes, and you earn a commission. You get to tell people about something that you love, and that has helped you, and recommend it to others. Everyone wins! Your readers find a great new product or service, and it doesn’t cost them anything extra. Sometimes they can even get a coupon or discount through your recommendation. How great is that! HOW DO I EARN AFFILIATE COMMISSIONS? There are three different ways to earn income from an affiliate. Percentage: You receive a percentage of the sale of a product. Before you join any affiliate program, you will be told what percentage you will earn. The amount can range from around 4% to 50%, depending on the product or service. Commission Per Lead: This is when you get a fixed amount for providing a customer with a new lead, such as signing up for an account. This amount can range from a few cents to a few dollars per lead. Fixed Amount: This is a set commission that you receive regardless of the price of the product or service. DO I NEED A LOT OF READERS OR FOLLOWERS TO MAKE MONEY? You don’t need millions of people reading your blog each month to earn income. But to increase your income, you will need to keep your blog growing. When you understand what your readers are looking for and how to find affiliate programs, you should be able to make money from your site. There is so much to learn about blogging and marketing. Trends and technology change quickly and sometimes it’s hard to find current information. If you want to learn more, I suggest taking an online class on affiliate marketing. CREATE YOUR OWN ONLINE CLOTHING STORE Thanks to online store builders, it’s now easier than ever to create your own shop online – and start selling within minutes! WHAT BRAND OF CLOTHING SELLS BEST Now that you know where to sell your clothes, your probably wondering what you should sell. Look at sites like eBay and Poshmark to see what brands are in demand. Remember that top brands aren’t guaranteed to sell, so use your best judgment. According to an eBay top seller, these are some of the best selling brands: J CrewNorth FaceLululemonHOW TO PRICE YOUR CLOTHING A good rule of thumb to consider when you sell clothes for cash is that you typically set the price at about one-third of the original retail price. If you bought the clothing at a second-hand store, or you don’t remember what you paid for it, you could look it up online. eBay and Poshmark are good sites to visit when trying to decide how to price an item. When determining a price, you want to look at items that are already sold on eBay or similar sites. Summary There are so many options for making money online, you just have to pick the one that works best for you.

Technically, you can’t earn money online without an investment. Because even if you don’t put money to invest, you still invest your “time”. Anyway, if you mean, what are the ways to earn money online without spending money, the answer is as follows. Making money online largely depends on your skill level and interests as well as the time you’re willing to put in. Here are some of the ways you can make money online: Freelance - you can be a freelancer (doesn’t mean only writing) and apply for various jobs in the area that you’re good at. Whether it be webdesign, writing, logo design, anything. There are a lot of jobs but the downside is there are a lot of applicants as well. Because of the volume of low bids, you may not get paid for what you’re worth. However, the more you do freelance work, the more your job portfolio would expand and you can eventually increase your rate. Go to upwork.com or freelancer.com to subscribe for free and apply/search for jobs that would suit you. You can also search for jobs at craigslist.com.Tutor - any profession can tutor. And because of the internet, we can connect to the whole world. If you’re good at what you do and feel you can share your knowledge and expertise to other people who would need extra help in the subject, by all means, tutor them online.Trade stocks - this all depends on the risk you’re willing to take and how you analyse the trend of the market. This is a good way to invest your money for a long-term period.Online business - you can again utilise the power of the internet and setup your own online business dedicated to the specific skill set that you have.Affiliate marketing - you can help other fishermen catch small fishes by leading them to the websites.Answer paid surveys - from memory, I think I personally saved $400 worth of groceries from gift cards I got from answering paid surveys. If you have a minute or two to spare online everyday, this would be worth a shot. Just make sure you find a paying survey website though. Mine is valuedopinions (australia) so not sure if it would be applicable to you.Buy and sell things - this is a classic way of making money. You can buy things on clearance sale for half the price and sell them for profit. The same thing can be done with second hand items. Buy those you think you can restore without spending too much and sell them for a good price. I’ve read many success stories of people who’ve gotten really rich being a “flipper”.Hope this helps. This information is taken from the book The 10-Step Strategy to Financial Freedom: A Millennial’s Guide to Money Management. It tackles everything you would need to sort out your money including personal finance, making money (including multiplying your source of income), budgeting, saving, investing, and retirement.

The best way to make money online without a big investment is 100% affiliate marketing. Nothing can match the low cost of entry and the earning potential, which is pretty mush limitless. I was aware of affiliate marketing at the time, but I didn’t understand it and so went with Amazon FBA as it was a business model that made more sense to me. The cost of entry is not small. You have to pay for the products to be made in China.You have to pay to ship them to U.SYou have to pay Amazon a monthly sellers fee of $50You have to pay Amazon a monthly warehouse feeYou have to pay Amazon a % of every saleYou have to pay for advertising on AmazonOverall, I sent about $10,000 to get my Amazon FBA business started. I enjoyed it and did ok from it, but if I could go back in time and start again, I would 100% start with affiliate marketing. Today I’ve closed my Amazon FBA business and focus 100% on affiliate marketing. The cost of entry is between $30-$100 per month. Depending on what products you promote and what tools you use. If you want to earn money without investment then go for Affiliate Marketing or Freelancing. Read this post until the end to understand what is Affiliate Marketing & Freelancing. Affiliate Marketing: What is affiliate marketing? Affiliate marketing is an option for website owners to make passive income by promoting links to products on their websites. By that, we mean you can make money even when you’re not working. The concept of affiliate marketing is to leverage your content to drive sales for a website by becoming a part of the Digital Marketing Funnel of specific products or brands. A publisher can, through content directed towards a niche audience, gather views on a webpage and then promote affiliate links on it in exchange for a commission. That means a single piece of content can generate revenue for a long time. The more content and visitors you have, the bigger the chances of making money with online affiliate marketing. All sales are automatically tracked via your affiliate link code, and you get a part of the profit every time a visitor buys from your links. How does affiliate marketing work? As you can see, for online affiliate marketing to work, you must have a website or another channel where you can promote links of merchants. Used by many big brands, such as Amazon, affiliate marketing campaigns have four key players: merchants: retailers or brands that promote affiliate marketing ads;networks: which provide offers to content producers;publishers: who promote affiliate links within their content;customer: the ultimate goal for marketers.The process for building revenue this way is easy and consists of the following steps: publish content with added links to products that may interest the audience of that content;make the offers attractive to generate as many clicks and purchases as possible;every time a customer clicks on your link, they are driven to the partner’s website;if your customer decides to make a purchase, you’re in luck;the store will record the transaction using your unique affiliate link to calculate your commission;as soon as the transaction is confirmed, the commission will be credited to your account;in due time, you get paid for your monthly commissions and are free to start the process all over again, linking to other products on your website.Freelancing: What is freelancing? Freelancing gives you freedom. Freedom of time, location, money, and emotion. You can work any time you want. You don’t have to bind yourself to a 9–5 job. You can work from anywhere in the world. There is no restriction. You can make as much money as you want. There is no limit. The more you work, the more you get paid. You can choose the persons you want to work with. You don’t have to work with the same boss every time. From writers to web designers, TV presenters to radio producers, many people in the media industry are ‘freelancers’. A freelancer is someone who doesn’t work for one company full-time but is hired by different companies for certain jobs. For example, a magazine or website will have a core team of editors who hire freelance writers to write articles, or a TV production crew might hire freelance cameramen to work on one series of programs. Advantages: Choose your work. Being a freelancer means you don’t have a boss telling you what to do so you can say ‘no’ to jobs you don’t want. You might also get to work at home for specific projects. As long as your work is delivered to the deadline most clients won’t mind how and when you do it – making freelancing a good option for people who don’t want to work normal office hours.Better pay. Freelancers can negotiate your own rates with the companies that hire you. Companies are often prepared to pay freelancers a better rate than their own staff because they don’t have to pay for things like sick leave as part of the contract. The more experience you have then the more money you can ask for.Disadvantages: Getting work. There are a lot of freelancers out there and getting your first few jobs can be hard. Just being good at what you do isn’t enough – you need to network, market yourself, and make contacts because no-one will hire you if they don’t know you’re there! The workload can be unpredictable – sometimes you might be working all night to meet three deadlines in one week, while even the most successful freelancers have months where they get no work at all.Managing your money. Not only will you not receive a regular paycheck per month, but you’ll also have to make all the tax and National Insurance arrangements employers would normally do for you. You need to register yourself as ‘self-employed’. You’ll also need to remember to keep some money aside for times when you’re ill or there’s no work – and while it might be great to have a holiday any time you want, remember that no-one will pay you for it!

Investment of what? There are endless ways to make money online with no capital, but that doesn't mean you won't have to invest. Take the Quora partner program, for instance (where you get paid for asking questions that get a lot of engagement). All you need is a Quora account, an internet-enabled device, and a mind! You clearly meet the first two criteria, so now you can prove that you've got the third by asking all kinds of questions that will get answered and start making money. But what you'll realize quickly is that there are no free lunches and no truly free ways to make money online. You'll spend a long time writing out questions that you think are useful, interesting and (most importantly) unique, only to find that your average return is $0.01 per question. Now take some of the other ways to make money online with little to no invested capital. You could start a marketing company and “educate” mom and pop businesses about the benefits of Instagram while taking cash out of their wallets. That's a pretty good bet right now for making some kind of return, but will it actually succeed? That all depends on if you can build a book of business from scratch. Which often takes marketing. Which usually takes money. So, not exactly the free ride you're looking for. The same logic applies to all kinds of online cash cows. Mechanical Turk, online coupon arbitrage, scalping, affiliate marketing, YouTube channels. To make real money online you have to find a way to do two things: 1) get people's attention and 2) drive them to take an action that is remunerative to you. Not exactly different from starting any kind of traditional business when you think of it that way.

Learning how to make money[1] always starts with yourself; if you want to learn how to make money and become wealthy, you need to take a good look at your reflection first and honestly ask yourself what you can do to improve and enhance your strengths while reducing your weaknesses. 10 Tips for Learning How to Make Money by Looking Within Know your interests.  This will let you know what kind of your job you’ll be happiest of. Don’t think about its profit potential first. What you should really be concerned about is to search for any interest that will make you enjoy work and get paid for something you love and don’t mind to do! Know your strengths and weaknesses in relation to your chosen field of profession.  When you’ve identified your key interests, this will lead you to your chosen profession. And when that happens, it’s time to take a good look at your reflection and know what makes you strong and weak. Afterwards, we do things to improve our strengths and reduce or eliminate our weaknesses. Invest effort in learning and gaining experience.  Don’t stop learning new things. It doesn’t have to be directly connected with your chosen field all the time. Any educational opportunity is ultimately beneficial because it exercises your mind. And of course, you’ve heard about how experience is the best teacher, and it’s still true. That’s why you should do your best to gain as much experience in your preferred job. Be ethical.  Contrary to popular opinion, good guys don’t finish last often nowadays. In fact, it’s the big guys who are now leading the pack. You only have to look at Bill Gates and Warren Buffett to understand this. Being ethical pays, but don’t do this just for the sake of higher returns. Do this because you know it’s right. Be fair to your clients, employees, employers, superiors, distributors, retailers, suppliers, and all other people who are working with you. Do unto them what you want them to do unto you in short. Set standards for your company.  Having standards is a way of motivating the people in your company or business to aim higher and do better. It also lets you know whether you’re making money or not, and if you are – whether you’re making as much as you should or not. If you aren’t, it lets you know what you’re doing right and what you’re doing wrong. Think of your work or business as a plant.  You need to nourish it if you want it to grow, blossom, and bear fruit. It will not survive solely on financial investment. For anything to become truly profitable, you first need to involve your body and soul into it. Rule by example. Your employees play a key part in turning your company around, and if you want them to perform well, you need to show them that you can and will always do what you’re asking them to do. And most importantly of all – don’t be afraid to take risks.  If you focus too much on what you could lose, you might lose track completely of what you could gain if you take the risk. Instead of being impulsive, weigh your options carefully to ascertain which risks are foolish…and which ones aren’t. Use your heart to know which risks have great potential, but use your head to decide which is right. Footnotes[1] Is This The End of Retail Arbitrage?

When you say investment, do you mean time, money, or both? Either way, you’re going to have to invest one or both of these things to actually see any kind of results. If you’re worried about not having the funds to get started on some kind of online project like affiliate marketing, then you’ll need to find a way to get those funds. Doing some simple tasks around your local area could net you enough to play around with, but if offering your time to your neighborhood doesn’t work for you then you could try offering your time and skills online instead. Fiverr and Upwork are a couple of such places. Fiverr allows you to throw up a few gigs for things like graphic design, content writing, programming or coding. Clients then find your gig and if they like what they see, they’ll purchase gigs from you and you’ll get paid for completing the services. It does take about a week before you’ll see those funds though… and Fiverr does take a small percentage from what you earn. Next up is Upwork which is similar but better for higher paying jobs. Upwork is a platform that allows clients from all over the world to outsource projects or jobs to freelancers like you. To earn money, you have to bid ont he projects you’re interested in and appeal to the client with a well written proposal (which takes some time and effort if you’re writing your proposals right). If you win the job, then you complete it, submit the work and if the client approves, the money is released from escrow within a week and a couple of days directly to your bank account. The only problem with Upwork is that there’s freelancers all over the world who are competing against you and may be willing to complete the job for a lot less than what you’re willing to. This can make bidding difficult. So using the two above methods you should have a no-excuse way to come up with initial funds to play around with. What’s next? I suggest affiliate marketing or even just throwing up a website and offering your own products on it. Affiliate marketing works well for those who don’t want to create their own products and just want to sell or promote someone else’s stuff. Selling your own products means you pocket more of the money since you’re not an affiliate, but it also means more work up front to create a product to offer for sale. Whatever you do, make sure you’re consistent and don’t fall into the trap that many internet marketers do… I’ve detailed some of them here.

The best way is to buy something cheap and “flip” it. What that means is to buy something cheap and sell it for a lot more than you paid. I’ll explain to you how it works but I can in no way guarantee it will work for you. Let’s say you’re somewhat of an expert in automobiles and know that a certain car in near mint condition is worth 20,000 dollars. Let’s say a friend of a friend is selling a car exactly like that one on the internet for 10,000. So what you’d do is buy the car for 10,000$ and if you could find someone who will pay 20,000 you’d make good money. If it works it’s a great deal, but there’s no guarantee it will work.

Make money online through DIP Digitize India Platform (DIP) is an initiative of the Government of India under the Digital India Programme to provide digitization services for scanned document images or physical documents for any organization. Any Indian citizen who fulfills the following prerequisites can become a Digital Contributor 1. Basic computer literacy 2. Aadhaar number (Mandatory) 3. Bank Account linked to your Aadhaar number 4. Access to internet 5. Access to any smart device (like a desktop or laptop, tablet or smart mobile phone) Digital Contributor can perform simple data entry tasks on the DIP. For every verified and correct task performed, the contributor will earn reward points. Rewards points can be redeemed into monetary value.
